summary: This is an email update dated August 23, 2019, detailing the status of the investigation into Jeffrey Epstein's death at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). It covers video evidence handling, interviews with BOP guards, coordination for evidence collection, autopsy status, scheduled inmate proffers, and a separate sex/drug investigation involving a correction officer named Harris.

events.title: Epstein Death Investigation Update
events.description: Email update summarizing investigative steps following Jeffrey Epstein's death, including guard interviews, video evidence packaging, autopsy coordination, and scheduling of inmate proffers.

events.title: Scheduled Inmate Proffers
events.description: Three proffers are scheduled with inmates who were in the MCC at the time of Epstein's death, expected to discuss Epstein and potential guard misconduct.

events.title: Cell Phone Retrieval for Thomas
events.description: Coordination made to retrieve and image the cell phone of an individual named Thomas as part of the investigation.

events.title: Contraband Discovery Involving Harris
events.description: A BOP guard searched Correction Officer Harris and discovered contraband, and received Harris's first statement regarding allegations against another guard.

keyFacts: Video from the MCC regarding Epstein's death was downloaded for AUSAs to view but was not enhanced, manipulated, or altered.
Two BOP guards were interviewed; they reported responding to a 'body alert' for Epstein, who had no vitals when they arrived, and one escorted the body to the hospital.
The autopsy was administered by Dr. Ho, and the OCME anticipated finalizing its report soon.
A separate sex/drug investigation involves Correction Officer Harris, with initial analysis supporting a link to another correction officer and contraband discovered on August 14, 2019.
Three inmate proffers were scheduled for August 26, 2019, to discuss the Epstein incident and potential guard misconduct at the MCC.
